citation.article-title: Transfer of Peptococcus indolicus, Peptococcus asaccharolyticus, Peptococcus prevotii and Peptococcus magnus to the genus Peptostreptococcus and proposal of Peptostreptococcus tetradius sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Peptostreptococcus tetradius sp. nov.
Peptostreptococcus tetradius sp. nov. (te.tra'di.us. Gr. adj. tetradios by fours; N. L. masc. adj. tetradius occurring in groups of four)
Cells are 0.8 to 1.8 μm in diameter and occur mostly in pairs or tetrads. occasionally in short chains or masses.
Colonies on sheep blood agar range from pinpoint to 1.2 mm in diameter.
Strains are nonhemolytic and make no black colonies on either rabbit or sheep blood agar after 7 days of anaerobic incubation.
The major metabolic end products in PYG broth cultures are butyrate and lactate.
No strain produces coagulase or indole or reduces nitrate.
Catalase production is variable among strains.
All strains produce urease and ferment fructose, glucose, maltose, mannose, and sucrose.
They do not make acid from arabinose, cellobiose, esculin, lactose, mannitol, raffinose, rhamnose, or sorbitol.
They produce ammonia from threonine and serine, but not from glycine.
Isolated from human vaginal discharge and various purulent secretions.
The G+C content of the DNA is 30 to 32 mol% (Tm).
The type strain is strain GIFU 7672 (= ATCC 35098 = JCM 1964 = CCM 3634).
Tetrad formation is not always observed and cannot be used as a distinctive trait to separate this species from other anaerobic cocci.

Urease and β-glucuronidase activities and fermentation of fructose, glucose, maltose, mannose, and sucrose are useful characters for separating Peptostreptococcus tetrudius from Peptostreptococcus prevotii.
